channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: US says strikes on Iran-linked sites in Iraq and Syria just 'the beginning'
item.description: President Joe Biden says he will order new action "as appropriate", following Friday's air strikes in Iraq and Syria.

item.title: Jaywick dog attack: Woman visiting grandson is killed by dogs
item.description: Esther Martin's daughter told the BBC how neighbours helped "fight off" the dogs with spades.

item.title: Clapham attack: 'I thought three-year-old victim was going to die in my arms'
item.description: A witness who came to the rescue of an assaulted three-year-old tells the BBC she rushed her to hospital.

item.title: Russian oil getting into UK via refinery loophole, reports claim
item.description: Russian oil is refined in other countries and sold into the UK as jet fuel and diesel, research claims.

item.title: Grammys 2024: Kylie Minogue, Billie Eilish, Joni Mitchell and The Beatles win early awards
item.description: Kylie Minogue wins her second ever Grammy Award, for Padam Padam, ahead of the main ceremony.

item.title: Huge atom-smasher bid to find missing 95% of Universe
item.description: Researchers want a new, much bigger supercollider but is it worth us paying the £17bn price tag?

item.title: Former Scottish Labour leader Kezia Dugdale admits voting SNP
item.description: Kezia Dugdale tells the BBC she backed the party at the 2019 European Parliament election because of Brexit.

item.title: Chris Mason: NI power-sharing affords Rishi Sunak chance for a victory lap
item.description: BBC political editor Chris Mason looks ahead to Rishi Sunak's trip to Belfast as Northern Ireland's executive returns.

item.title: Jockey Keagan Kirkby dies after fall at horse race in Kent
item.description: Tributes are being paid to Keagan Kirkby, who was riding when his horse ran into the side of a jump.

item.title: Scottish prisons are full, 'we can't take any more'
item.description: Teresa Medhurst says Scotland's prisons are reaching "tipping point" and inmates could be released early.

item.title: Emma Hayes: Chelsea manager says lack of female coaches 'a massive issue'
item.description: Outgoing Chelsea manager Emma Hayes says a lack of female coaches in English football is "a massive issue" and urged the game to "come up with more creative ways" to address it.

item.title: Chile forest fires: At least 99 dead in Valparaíso region
item.description: President Boric announced a state of emergency as forest fires scorched the Valparaíso region.

item.title: China can now monitor government-funded projects 24/7
item.description: The rules, which took effect this month, come as officials move to support the crisis-hit property industry.

item.title: The Papers: 'Horrifying' dog attack and 'bonkers' week of weather
item.description: Monday's papers report on the death of a 68-year-old woman after a dog attack in Essex.

item.title: Grammy Awards 2024: Red carpet and ceremony in pictures
item.description: See the most eye-catching images and outfits as stars attend the music industry's biggest party.

item.title: Xiang Yang Hong 3: Chinese ship's port call flares India tension
item.description: A Chinese research ship's imminent arrival at Male has flared tensions between Beijing and Delhi.

item.title: Imran Khan: How Pakistan ex-PM plans to win an election from jail
item.description: The former Pakistan PM's party believes new tactics can help it win elections despite a crackdown.

item.title: Ukraine war: No more easy deals for Russian convicts freed to fight
item.description: Russian prisoners released to fight in Ukraine are no longer offered a presidential pardon and face stricter conditions.

item.title: Iceland volcano: Grindavik's people may never return after volcano spills lava into town
item.description: Grindavik now lies empty, its people have fled, after molten lava seeped into the town.

item.title: Neuralink: Can Musk's brain technology change the world?
item.description: The world's richest man is betting heavily on his brain chip, but he has ground to make up.

item.title: What are routes out of this 'dangerous moment' in Middle East?
item.description: BBC's Paul Adams asks whether US strikes on Iraq and Syria made a regional conflagration more likely.

item.title: Did bodybuilding bring on my early perimenopause?
item.description: Adele Johnston was 33 when she developed painful symptoms such as heart palpitations and itchy skin.

item.title: Clapham attack: £20,000 reward in search for Abdul Shokoor Ezedi
item.description: Abdul Shokoor Ezedi was last seen leaving Tower Hill Underground station on Wednesday, police say.

item.title: 'Sadistic' teenagers tried to get away with Brianna murder
item.description: The pair who killed Brianna Ghey in broad daylight arrogantly thought they were too clever to be caught.

item.title: Laura Kuenssberg: When will politicians make their minds up on key plans?
item.description: No wonder voters are unconvinced when politicians may seem unclear on economic plans, writes Laura Kuenssberg.

item.title: Historic day in NI stirs painful memories - and hope for change
item.description: Ex-Northern Ireland correspondent Fergal Keane returns to Belfast, 40 years after reporting on the Troubles, to reflect on a changed city.

item.title: Ros Atkins on… Iran, its proxies and the ‘Axis of Resistance’
item.description: The BBC's analysis editor explains the Iran-backed militia groups at the centre of US strikes.

item.title: Confronting the Houthis: How powerful are Yemen’s rebel rulers?
item.description: The Houthis represent only around 15% of Yemenis, yet consider themselves the rightful rulers.

item.title: Abdul Shokoor Ezedi: What do we know of Clapham attack suspect?
item.description: The 35-year-old convicted sex offender is believed to live in Newcastle and had been granted asylum.

item.title: Family life: Mum rejects social media perfection for mayhem
item.description: Mum-of-five Jessica Hymus-Gant shares the good as well as the "grotty" reality of family life.

item.title: Universal Studios UK: Is a theme park coming to Stewartby?
item.description: What might a major new theme park mean for a Bedfordshire village and its 1,200 inhabitants?

item.title: Ae forest pine marten poo count shows number growth
item.description: A "basic survey method" shows the creatures are doing well in two south of Scotland forests.

item.title: Stalking and assaults 'threatening local democracy'
item.description: Stalking, threats and assaults are putting people off standing for election, local government groups warn.

item.title: Parisians vote for rise in parking fees for SUVs
item.description: The vote was called by mayor Anne Hidalgo, who says SUVs are dangerous and bad for the environment.

item.title: World Cup 2026: MetLife Stadium in New Jersey to host World Cup final on 19 July
item.description: The MetLife Stadium in New Jersey will host the 2026 World Cup final on 19 July, while the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City will stage the opening group game on 11 June.

item.title: Measles: Urgent Wales call on MMR vaccine for children
item.description: Health boards in Wales are asked to target pupils in every school to boost immunisation levels.

item.title: Gillian Keegan: I'm confident of 15 hours of free childcare by April
item.description: But the education secretary does not confirm the scheme will be ready for all eligible parents.

item.title: Bristol stabbings: Teenager charged with murder of two boys
item.description: A 17-year-old boy is due before magistrates over the deaths of Mason Rist and Max Dixon.

item.title: Kate Garraway to return to TV role after husband Derek Draper's funeral
item.description: She will return to Good Morning Britain next week following the death of her husband, Derek Draper.

item.title: Flooding risk for Scotland as heavy rain expected
item.description: A yellow weather warning has come into force for parts of the country and will last until 21:00 on Monday.

item.title: Scoop film: Netflix releases first photos of Prince Andrew movie
item.description: Gillian Anderson is seen as Emily Maitlis and Rufus Sewell as Andrew in the first official photos.

item.title: Wales and Lions legend Barry John dies aged 79
item.description: Barry John, the legendary former Cardiff, Wales and British and Irish Lions fly-half, dies aged 79.

item.title: Brianna Ghey: I would speak to killer Scarlett Jenkinson's mum, her mother says
item.description: Esther Ghey tells the BBC she wants the mother of Scarlett Jenkinson to know she does not blame her.

item.title: Rufford Ford: Is ford loved by TikTokers a danger or harmless fun?
item.description: Council officials want to see the infamous ford permanently closed on safety grounds.

item.title: Reggie Kray's handwritten letters to be sold at auction
item.description: Letters written by Reggie Kray while serving a life sentence will go under the hammer in Tetbury.

item.title: Arsenal 3-1 Liverpool: 'Arsenal have placed themselves at heart of three-way title race'
item.description: "There's a long way to go" but Arsenal's win over Liverpool was "the biggest moment of their season", writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: India v England: James Anderson says hosts will be nervous of tourists' run-chase
item.description: James Anderson says India are nervous about England pulling off another chase in the second Test in Visakhapatnam.

item.title: Arsenal 3-1 Liverpool: How Gunners gave Premier League leaders 'a taste of their own medicine' - Danny Murphy
item.description: MOTD2 pundit Danny Murphy explains why Arsenal's plan worked so well in their impressive win over Premier League leaders Liverpool.

item.title: Lisandro Martinez: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag says injury 'doesn't look good'
item.description: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag says he is concerned about the injury Lisandro Martinez sustained in the 3-0 win against West Ham.

item.title: Controversial penalties help Chelsea stay top of WSL
item.description: Two controversial penalties set Chelsea on the way to beating Everton to remain on track for a fifth consecutive Women's Super League title.

item.title: MOTD2: 'They're a hell of a side' - how Arsenal beat Liverpool
item.description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Danny Murphy and Shay Given praise Arsenal's "brilliant" display in their 3-1 win against Premier League leaders Liverpool.

item.title: MOTD2 analysis: How Pedro Neto and Matheus Cunha 'ran Chelsea ragged' at Stamford Bridge
item.description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Danny Murphy and Shay Given praise Wolves attackers Matheus Cunha and Pedro Neto for playing key roles in their 4-2 win against Chelsea.
